intro: Solanum cutervoanum, commonly known as the Cutervo nightshade, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces violet to purple flowers that bloom in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators. Its berries are toxic and contain alkaloids, making it a plant of both botanical interest and caution. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
